messages.content: I am writing about the General Election on December 12th. David Gauke, former Tory Lord Chancellor, has said that a Tory victory and the hard Brexit it would bring would be “disastrous” – extremely damaging for both farming and manufacturing. However, the Lib Dems only got 3% of the vote here last time - they cannot win. The only way to stop the Tories in this very marginal constituency, and to prevent this “disastrous” Brexit, is to vote for me.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will achieve net zero emissions in the 2030s and will launch a £250 billion Green Industrial Revolution, creating millions of jobs in every region.
Labour will set up a North East Regional Development Bank, run from the North East, to support the private sector and invest in good jobs.
Labour will provide free, high quality nursery places for all 2-4 year olds, and extend paid maternity leave to 12 months.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Lib Dems only got 3% of the vote here last time - they cannot win.

issues.brexitEurope: David Gauke, former Tory Lord Chancellor, has said that a Tory victory and the hard Brexit it would bring would be “disastrous” – extremely damaging for both farming and manufacturing. The only way to stop the Tories in this very marginal constituency, and to prevent this “disastrous” Brexit, is to vote for me.
issues.economy: Labour will set up a North East Regional Development Bank, run from the North East, to support the private sector and invest in good jobs. This will include a new local network to make loans to small businesses.
issues.education: Labour will provide free, high quality nursery places for all 2-4 year olds, and extend paid maternity leave to 12 months. It will reduce class sizes in primary schools, abolish student loans and invest in further and adult education.
issues.environment: On climate change, Labour will achieve net zero emissions in the 2030s and will launch a £250 billion Green Industrial Revolution, creating millions of jobs in every region. The Tories have dithered and delayed – and made “incredibly slow progress” according to one business group.
issues.socialWelfare: When I was first elected there were no food banks in this constituency. Now after nine years of Tory government there are seven.

endorsements.endorsement: Helen Goodman busted a gut to get a sensible Brexit.
